metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9233 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In wpa_supplicant_8, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID: A-122529021

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eapoltest - 2:2.9.0-21
hostapd - 2:2.9.0-21
wpagui - 2:2.9.0-21
wpasupplicant - 2:2.9.0-21
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This CVE was assigned to Android, impact on Ubuntu is unknown introduced by https://w1.fi/cgit/hostap/commit/?id=bb598c3bdd06

criterions.comment: wpa package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.9.0-21').
